meta.title: Custom IT | Bespoke Engineering on Demand
meta.description: When off-the-shelf doesn't fit. Bespoke development, APIs, dashboards, data pipelines, and technical debugging.

forWho.title: Is this for you?
forWho.description: Custom IT is for businesses with specific technical needs that off-the-shelf solutions can't address.
points: Need to connect systems that don't have existing integrations
Have legacy systems that need modernization
Face technical problems no one else can solve

problem.title: The problem
problem.description: You have a specific technical need that doesn't fit into a standard service box. Maybe you need a custom API to connect two systems. Maybe you need a dashboard that shows exactly what you need. Maybe you have a legacy system acting up. Generic solutions don't fit.

solution.title: Our approach
solution.description: We scope custom work carefully, build what you need, and hand it off properly. No bloated enterprise solutions. No vendor lock-in. Clean, documented code that works.

items.description: Data visualization tailored to your needs

timeline.title: Timeline & expectations
timeline.description: Varies by project. Small scripts: days. Custom APIs: weeks. Complex systems: months. Every project gets a clear timeline before we start. No open-ended engagements.

faq.question: What technologies do you work with?
faq.answer: Modern web technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, Node.js, React. Cloud services: AWS, GCP. Databases: PostgreSQL, MongoDB. We assess your existing stack and recommend accordingly.

faq.question: Do you do maintenance?
faq.answer: We include a support period with every project. Long-term maintenance is available as a separate engagement or we can hand off to your team.

faq.question: Can you help with something broken?
faq.answer: Yes. We take on debugging and technical rescue projects. We assess the situation, provide honest estimates, and fix what needs fixing.

faq.question: How do you price custom work?
faq.answer: Fixed quotes after scoping. We don't do open-ended hourly billing. You know the cost before we start.
